page.title: 01TOWARD IN GENERAL
page.content: {TOWARD The Gaelic name for Toward is{Dughard dugh black ,ard height (The Black Height). Toward is situated on the Cowal peninsula.In and around it is all countryside. It is a peaceful quiet place with rolling hills,trickling burns (streams) and pleasant woods. On Toward hill there are two farms,one dairy and one sheep and beef. The woods are mainly deciduous but there are some Pine.The deciduous woods are partly choked with Rhodedendron bushes but are still inhabited by rabbits,other small animals and the occasional Roe deer. The burns flow on curving courses from Dughard hill and in Spring you can see young trout going down to the sea. {Toward cont on page 2.
